title: Great place. Silly name.
text: Don't be put off by the silly name. It is very good and lots of interesting things to do. Only thing I would say is that the atmosphere inside is quite stuffy and makes you feel sleepy. Hard to stay lively and enthusiastic for the kids. Maybe they should have called it We Be The Curious, to make it sound more Bristolian. It used to be called @Bristol which is equally strange. Never mind.

title: An abundance of mouldy fruit and veg
text: An abundance of mouldy and rotten and well-past-its-best fruit and veg. Prices of fruit and veg reflect the fact it is supposedly organic. But it's mouldy and mushy and rotten so rubbish. Avoid if you can.

title: Everything was excellent.
text:
Thanks again to all the staff. We never SAW a smile but we think that everyone was smiling behind their mask . Everything was excellent. The location, the facilities, spotlessly clean, beautiful water quality in all 3 pools. Great gym, VERY VERY helpful reception - booking tennis for us at Club de Campo, gave first aid, free mask, loads of help and advice.

Fantastic breakfasts, extra coffee as needed, very high quality food and excellent service. Such a lovely experience as it is so nice to be ‘looked after’ on any Ibiza holiday which can take its toll on the senses!

Cannot recommend highly enough. 5 stars all the way.

David

title: 12 July 2020
text: Information only. It is open but you have to reserve sunsets in advance. Evenings - I would suggest avoid. Last night we went down and the disco inside was on and looked OK but very blokey and not many people inside. We were informed that you had to book a 'table' inside but there were none available in any case. If you do book a table you have to agree to a minimum spend of 160 euros on beer. So not great if there are 2 of you, etc, etc, etc.

title: 12 July 2020. All good at Pikes.
text:
Excellent day at Pikes today. All the staff were really friendly and brilliant service from all. We played tennis on their famous tennis court, had a lovely dinner there and also a drink when we first arrived. Staff wearing masks, we did not have to.

You have to book a restaurant slot or table to be able to go in so do not just turn up.

title: Family with teenagers - excellent long weekend
text:
We all had a really excellent 3 nights at this hotel. They gave us two rooms next door to each other, they gave us friendly and precise help and advice whenever we asked, the room service staff gave us excellent room service whenever we needed it, the breakfast was pretty good (not outstanding but pretty good), the rooms were very clean and good linen and the room cleaner was very nice and very friendly and helpful. At the end of the trip I left my keys in the room and they very kindly posted them to me in the UK, without charging me. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel...the location is excellent and you are proper 'in Athens'. Locally there are loads of Indian and middle-east influenced cafes and takeaways that are very cheap and very good holiday food...the kids loved it. Also, within a few streets - loads of little squares with eat outside facilities. You can walk everywhere from this hotel, and if not, it is near the metro. We walked everywhere and we all had a brilliant time.

Thank you everyone at Dorian Inn. We will be back to see you again as soon as we can.

NOTE: the restaurant on the roof (Point of View) is a different entity to the hotel, so I have reviewed that separately.

title: Excellent for all the family
text:
Very good. It was free entry on the day we visited. I would advise going early in the summer.; we went in March and it was fine, but it is a bit of a hike up and little shade so, in intense heat may be a little uncomfortable.

The only bad thing was many many men approaching us trying to chat to us and sell wrist bands. Too much of this. Also, on the way down, two men tried to pickpocket my partner's backpack. I would like to see some tourism Police around the site and on the approaches.

title: Disappointing when you realise the down side
text:
This rooftop restaurant is separate to the hotel it is in.

The hotel is great in every way but the rooftop restaurant can confuse people because you are entering a different domain.

The views are fantastic and the pool area is very nice and clean. The service I got was generally very good overall, regarding service and quality, and the portions and speed of delivery of the food our family had at lunch was excellent. However, the staff (particularly the evening staff, and particularly one male barman) can be very snooty. At 5pm they close the pool and its little sunbathing area. Presumably because from 5pm is 'their' time, not the hotel's time. This was very hard on my kids as they were hounded out of the pool at 4.59pm when the sun was fully shining. I also saw a hen party at 5.15pm not even allowed by the waiter to go out there for a photo by the pool. Also, I was told to go away because I was wearing a pair of the hotel's slippers instead of proper shoes more in keeping with a RESTAURANT.

The Point Of View restaurant is NOT the room service hub (that is on the first floor and a different phone number from the rooms), so you can not ask to borrow a corkscrew for example - IT IS A RESTAURANT - they announce snootily.

title: Always interesting.
text: There is always stuff to do and see here for all ages. Good cafe as well and the patio at the end is ideal in the summer for some sun.

title: No decent lager to drink, not even bottles
text:
Whatever has happened to bar owners' perception of their punters? Have some of you forgotten that lager is drunk in huge volumes in every bar in Britain? And have you forgotten that if you are going to provide lager, which you would be foolish not to, there are about a thousand known brands to choose from. If you can't get these household-name brands from your supplier (very hard to believe) you can easily get all of them from any cash and carry or Asda.

How can it be possible that I visited a large bar in central Bristol - even a pop-up - and there was NO lager? The only single lager on tap - which was only producing froth - was Sulis, by some dodgy English brewer, Bath Ales I think, trying to mimick the very well established German pilsner style that so many of us know and love. It isn't lager actually, it's just wishy washy stuff. Kubik Pale Ale alongside it - just as bad. Anyway, not lager.

Not even any bottles of lager. Nothing. No Christmas Belgian beer, no Staropramen or Budweiser Budvar to give us a wintery lager experience of colder places in the east of Europe.

Rubbish. Not recommended. Staff were helpful but mainly there to socialise amongst themselves and there was someone asleep in one of the 'lounge bar' areas. Wouldn't it be nice to have something like - a German Christmas Market with German lager in steins? Had anyone thought that might be much better than this crappy Apres bar? If I go back to Millennium Square this month, which I probably will, I will be taking my own lager in bottles. Plenty of places to sit, away from the Apes Bar.

title: Family of 5 (inc. 3 teenagers), October... fantastic holiday. Great place.
text:
I booked a Centerparcs trip, they gave us a holiday. This park is like a mini Longleat (which is our local UK Centerparcs) but the strapline ‘the holiday the weather can’t spoil’ is the most important part. As it happens, the weather was glorious and we did family bike rides on the myriad of clearly-posted flat Cycle Routes around the lake, spent a lot of time outside and at the farmyard zoo and adventure golf, etc. But the swimming paradise is always there to fall back on and the one here is just as much fun as it needs to be.
We did the flowrider twice, which is extremely good value for money at 11 euros each for a whole hour. And we had lunch in the pool complex once.

What did it for me was the entertainment hall. There was something going on whenever we went there. Great fun, excellent stage shows and great entertainment from the animation team. Table bar service, so none of that HORRIBLE post-office style queuing up at the Sports Village in Longleat. Speaking of that place, yes, I missed the racquet sports and the gym, as there is no sports hall at De Eemhof. But I did go on a serious 30km bike ride which I would not have done at Longleat.

title: A brilliant stop in the centre of town for European travellers and everyone else
text:
I first went on holiday to Mangalore in 2002. The Liqud Lounge was just getting started there. Since then, many many times every year (except sadly 2 or 3 :( ) we always hang out there on our stays in the city. The staff are always excellent and remember us and cannot do enough for us. I have had so many of my best ever times in India in this place. All family members, even the youngest kids were and are always welcomed with open arms. The family that own it are lovely and we have a great affection for this place and the owners and staff.

No holiday or work trip to Mangalore or Karnataka would be complete without a trip to the Liquid Lounge in Mangalore and I wouyld, and do, highly recommend it to all my family and friends travelling from the Uk to india. Food, drinks, cocktails, service, all excellently done. Keep up the good work guys. See you soon.

title: A must for UK and European tourists in Mangalore
text: I love this bar/resto. If you are in Mangalore and fancy a pub [slash] American bar with a sit-outside area to watch the Mangalore world go by, choose Froth on Top. Excellent location, excellent food, lovely staff and service. Great atmosphere. Any time of the day, it is great. I love this family-run small chain of bars and restaurants. I have been regularly to the others, which I'll review separately and no holiday or work trip to Mangalore or karnatak would be complete without a trip to the Froth on Top or Liquid Lounge in Mangalore. Plus, our kids were and are always welcomed affectionately. Perfect for all ages.

title: Very good high quality evening out. Family of 5, with 3 teenagers.
text: Everything was as I'd hoped and expected. We all had a really good time. Gluten free options were very good. Food standard and service very good.

title: Bar - The DJ was really good and the bar service is excellent.
text: Had a really great night at the bar last night (Friday). The DJ was really good and the bar service is excellent. Recommended for cocktails, atmosphere, service and music.
place: Harvey Nichols Second Floor Restaurant and Bar

title: Lovely swimming pool
text:
We had a great time at this stopover campsite but only because it has some key facilities. Some animals to feed, which is great, some open field space for ball games, and a lovely fantastic indoor tropical multi-function pool.

But this campsite is characterised by old-fashioned campsite traits and overbearing administration. No toilet rolls in the toilets, not even in the swimming pool toilets, which is asking for trouble. A plastic card to activate minute by minute showers, a card and code to get in and out, pool wristbands, and Lots of deposits and paperwork. Dominated by permanent pitches,which doesn't make for the greatest, most-relaxed atmosphere. There is a bar but we didn't go in it.

No food or shop on site. We were very lucky to find an open Friterie up the road. Beware if arriving late, nothing open in town at all at 9.15pm when we arrived on a normal Tuesday.

title: Lovely healthy breakfast
text:
Loads of great modern healthy breakfast options. Fruit, oats, pastries, excellent. Lovely coffee.

Staff are very nice.

title: Generally quite nice but too chainy
text:
Very nice, neat, family-friendly, campsite. Decent open air pool for small children. Nice pitches. Clean toilets and showers. However, very basic pub-menu food that is overpriced and small portions. This is because it's a franchise or chain, I guess. You have to queue up, post-office single-file style, order at the bar, from a very basic burger/pizza/etc. menu. Not very French, not at all good value for money. Very dry. No gluten free.

There is a lake with an inflatable, but it is not very good as there are sharp edges. Two of our three kids had cuts from the lake floor or rough inflatable edges.

All in all, quite uninspiring. Probably good for very small children. But generally re-priced.

Great supermarket nearby.
No shop on site.
Bar stays open late and there was a band on. So that's good.

title: Snooty and just plain silly staff, and silly food and drink service policies.
text: Really rude and silly female waiting staff. Very illogical ideas and attitudes towards when to and when not to serve food and drink, and where, and what tables, etc etc etc. Confused policies and timings. Snooty and just plain silly. Avoid if you want a simple experience of food and drink.

title: Rude owner
text: I booked via booking.com. Owner phoned me and was extremely rude and unpleasant. He told me a booking.com payment in advance had been declined. He said I had 12 hours to decide and then he said he was cancelling it, which is what he did. Thank god for that, as I do not fancy taking my family to a place owned and run by such an unpleasant person.

title: Guaranteed fantastic family holiday
text: So many things to say, all positive. Just go on their website and image that you and your children can do anything you want there and the time just flies by. Our kids, in one day, did sub aqua, javelin, paddle board with other children in an organised social, padel tennis, road bike (free road bike rental), mini golf. As well as the regular leisure pool stuff.
place: Club La Santa - all sports inclusive

title: Excellent service
text: Dear Doreen, mother and niece have arrived safely back in the UK, and very happy with their stay at the TAJ Gateway. Thank you very much for all your kind and efficient assistance throughout. With the Jet Airways problems we were all concerned but your team helped put our minds at rest with documentation and assistance. Your communications and attentiveness Doreen was extremely helpful and dependable and again, thanks on a personal level. We hope that some of our family will be visiting the TAJ Gateway again soon.
place: The Gateway Hotel Old Port Rd Mangalore

title: Hotel great. Beefeater restaurant - TERRIBLE.
text:
The Premier Inn was as usual excellent. Very nice receptionist, no problems at all.
We had dinner on the meal deal in the Beefeater pubby restaurant downstairs. Absolutely terrible. Verging on inedible. laughable, awful, disgraceful excuse for restaurant food. Nachos: never seen anything like this. NO cheese, no melted cheese at all! had to ask for a pot of grated cheese and I was treated as if nobody in the world had ever expected cheese on nachos. Is this a Swansea thing? It can't be. Surely nachos always has cheese? Squirted greyish salsa around some tired totilla chips, no guacamole. Absolutely terrible. Nothing fresh or real on the plate. Prawn cocktail a joke. All sauce hardly any prawns. etc etc. Terrible. Avoid. Not even cheap.

title: Used to be good
text: There was a time when this place had very friendly staff and served excellent authentic south Indian food, prepared by Indian people. Then it moved next door. On this visit I found the food Bland and samey and then a substantial service charge was added that we were not expecting. We were the only ones in there and all in all, this was a bad experience and not good value for money.

title: Built so that people from Birmingham could take a faster route to Weston Super Mare
text:
As bridges go this is quite good. 

Very attractive bridge. Built so that people from Birmingham could take a faster route to Weston Super Mare. Legend has it that a Victorian lady jumped off to commit suicide but her big skirt puffed up like a parachute and she floated down to the ground below. Modern day suicides are more successful and you will see a concrete tunnel below the bridge, spanning the road, so that any jumpers land on that, rather than vehicles.

title: Amazing range of drinks
text: Without doubt the best pub in Bedminster and Southville, BS3. Huge range of well known brand names that you look for when out. Guest ales available for chin strokers but most importantly they have all the beers and ciders you know and love. Plus Gin Palace, Vodka range, etc etc etc. Table service. Food served until 11.30pm. Absolutely top of the heap. Why drink overpriced unknown beers that taste like dishwater when you can come here. Friendly staff, great service and great location.

title: Lots to do. Excellent park.
text: Worth travelling to. Golf course, kids bmx track, general playground, running track, free to use bowling green, free parking. Very good park. I wish all parks still had so much to offer.

title: Very good leisure pool, warm water.
text: Cafe closed at lunchtime due to staff lunchbreak. Apart from that, all round very good experience. Free parking, reasonable price for family ticket. Kids stayed in a long time.

title: Cocktails and service very good
text: Excellent atmosphere. Not packed but relaxed punters and very friendly and helpful staff. Good music, very good sound system and the cocktails were easy to order, well presented and did not involve a long wait at the bar. Recommended.

title: Curry night is on the way out in GB
text: I think this is the reason why the British curry restaurant is in decline. This establishment caters for the tipsy city centre reveller. Not a fine dining experience and on reflection one wishes one had not been. I know I can go to classy places like Thali cafe, and comprehensive places like zaza bazaar and get high quality decent Indian food with good ingredients and varied and interesting Indian food items. But I would be visiting them sober and with high expectations. On this visit to the Raj, food was served in large quantities and with 'lowest common denominator' spice and flavour factors. You really would only appreciate it after ten pints and it was extremely Bland. I don't recommend this place at all but, like a donor kebab, at the right time after a certain amount of beer, it hits the spot. That's all.

title: Not ethical and not fresh
text:
I use this shop regularly because it is the closest shop to my home in Southville. However, it is extremely expensive and the fruit and veg is of low quality. It may be organic and possibly some of it sourced locally, but so much of it is rarely fresh and quite often I see fruit and veg that is positively off. I noticed that the mejoul dates are from Israel so I'm not sure where their 'ethical' boundaries lie. 'Ethical' is in their header strap line on signage, so I think they should come right out and say whether or not they support the Israeli apartheid regime. You expect from places like Asda a non-caring or not thought out sourcing philosphy but a shop that pronounces ethical sourcing should explain why it advertises Israel in its shop. You can import dates from Palestine or central Africa

Hobbs House bread stockist, so low quality pappy bread available.

Stockist of Southville Hop beer so that is one good thing.

Make sure you have plenty of cash on you when shopping here. And, is the veg really organic and local? Or was it procured from the bins behind asda?

title: A horrible range of overpriced dishwater beer and not very nice, arrogant staff
text:
Clientele: mixed men and women. The only good thing about it is that it isn't over blokey.
Beer: universally and comprehensively awful. Some of them are truly undrinkable. Overpriced by a long way.
Staff: generally quite rude, arrogant and condescending. If you don't stroke your chin while ordering or tasting from a range of orangey and lemony dishwater concoctions, you will be looked at and spoken to as if they would rather you left.
Location: very good.
Value for money: terrible.
Demographic: White middle class middle-aged bubble.

I have been to this place several times and finally decided to give it the bad review it so deserves. I honestly can't ever believe it is so bad so I occasionally give it another try. Last night I paid 8.70 for a fizzy water and a bottle of supposedly Belgian beer (33cl). I managed half of it before giving up as it was lemony and tasted nothing like any Belgian beer I have ever had. I physically could not finish it as it was so unpleasantn and one of my friends could not drink his 33cl of pale ale draught dishwater.

Avoid this place unless you want to mix with the kind of people mentioned above and sample dishwater in 33cl glasses. That this place is so busy, to me, is worrying.

title: Lovely food. Fabulous hosts.
text:
I was with my 12 year old daughter in Ostende at 2.15pm getting hungry. Car navigator took me to Hilde's restaurant De Vlasschaard. What a find!! Very welcoming Hilde and her staff. The food was excellent, and large portions. Quick service, attentive and friendly at all time. Cannot praise it enough. Cosy, and quirky. So so easy and I cannot speak any Flemish so I praise the experience very highly as a tourist in need of some quick, easy, wholesome grub. By the way, my steak was lovely and the deserts equally lovely and generous portioned.

To top it all, Hilde chatted to me about the area and gave me some great information. I cannot wait to go on one of her beer tours and hope to keep in touch.

All round MAGNIFIICENT. Long live Ostende, Belgian beer and De Vlasschaard.

title: Doors got stuck
text:
It was going so well but when we 'arrived' back at Folkestone (this was a day trip), the front door of the train got stuck and would not open for disembarking. We had to wait an hour while they worked out what to do and eventually we all reversed and got out of the rear train door. Regular announcements gave no clue that there was an alternative door and I think we all thought we would be stuck there for the night. Solution, next time please say 'we are trying to fix the door, but don't worry, if we can't fix it soon we will get you reversed out. No need to panic'.

PS, on the way over ALL the toilets were flooded and overflowing and the flushes not working. felt like a thiord-world train. Yuk.

title: Too much MSG man
text: Very nice but please hold the salt and MSG next time. Greek style. Unusual and very nice. Done quickly and good service.

title: Ok. very good location. Thank you staff at The Carlton for a very friendly welcome and excellent service.
text:
The price led me here as I wanted a basic cheap overnight stop before boarding Eurotunnel early morning for a same-day return.

Perfect for Eurotunnel as a ten-minute drive to the terminal. Basically, this is a one or two star hotel (no idea how to class it but i would accept their classification of 2, without quibbling). It cost me £10 per night more than an overnight parking ticket at Maidstone services. A WHOLE lot better than sleeping in a van in a motorway services. Excellent location, 3 minutes to all the takeaways and supermarket.

Room very basic, clean sheets and clean towels, warm (with a heater), sea view. Electric shower (no need to say more), pretty grubby generally in the room but you get what you pay for. Decent TV.

PLUS - extremely nice man running the place greeted us very politely and was very very pleasant at all times. The ground floor and reception is very smart and nicely decorated. The bar is excellent and the lounge also very nice with a gas fire and large TV playing music. He let us bring takeaways to the room which some hotels don't like. The breakfast we took on the second morning was perfectly OK for £7 each, including a decent full English, unlimited toast and all the cereals and condiments and coffee on a buffet table. Can't really argue with that. 24 hour main door security.

To be honest, not sure I would go back unless their restaurant that is being refurbished is an Indian restaurant, which it might be. This was a budget trip to buy stock in Belgium and costs were being kept to the minimum. I went with my 12-year-old daughter who - incidentally - loved it!!! but if I was going again with all the family I would be paying more and staying elsewhere, like the snob I am ;)

Thank you staff at The Carlton for a very friendly welcome and excellent service. I wish you all the best. It is a massive grand hotel and will take some doing to maintain and upgrade it. Keep up the good work.

title: similar facilities and feel to Brean Sands/Burnham on Sea
text:
I'd forgotten how middle class this part of France is. If you want to go on holiday in France and speak English all the time, see no black people nor east Europeans, etc etc., this bubble is perfect. I could be more specific about this site but generally I think that is over-safe, slightly boring, and has similar facilities and feel to Brean Sands/Burnham on Sea. Of course, the weather is more reliable and you can eat oysters and speak French if you really want to.

It's a lot cheaper than Croatia for example but a long drive, with the risk of bumping in to Fred and Janice from up the road.

Highlights: Excellent beach down the road but needs waves (otherwise boring). Towels cannot be used to bag and hold sunbeds on the campsite poolside. Pelforth on tap was lovely. Rude bar manager who actually was really easy to twist round your finger with some French and sympathising with his over-strict rules like no bare feet, no bare tops, no dripping water in the bar, no kids sitting on arms of sofas, etc etc etc.
place: Camping Marvilla Parks - Le Clarys Plage

title: my son's gluten free one was good too
text: Burgers were fine. no problem. And my son's gluten free one was good too. But the skinny fries are too skinny. Ridiculously skinny. No longer fries, they are so skinny.

title: The location is perfect for Notting Hill, Portobello, walk to Bayswater, Hyde Park
text:
Very very good. The bar/restaurant, and the hotel.

Friendly staff throughout, great pub and busy too and good music. Excellent breakfast. Excellent service. Excellent location. Flexible check in. Could not fault it. Some people on google reviews complain about lack of a lift. Come on. A few flights of stairs, and direct access to the street, as well as the pub/restaurant.

The owner seems to take a very keen interest in the place, visible in the pub setting up and arranging candles and fresh flowers.

Once again, highly recommended and the location is perfect for Notting Hill, Portobello, walk to Bayswater, Hyde Park and Knightsbridge. Near a tube station if you don't fancy walking.

title: Guaranteed fantastic family holiday
text: So many things to say, all positive. Just go on their website and image that you and your children can do anything you want there and the time just flies by. Our kids, in one day, did sub aqua, javelin, paddle board with other children in an organised social, padel tennis, road bike (free road bike rental), mini golf. As well as the regular leisure pool stuff.
place: Club La Santa - all sports inclusive

title: Excellent service
text: Dear Doreen, mother and niece have arrived safely back in the UK, and very happy with their stay at the TAJ Gateway. Thank you very much for all your kind and efficient assistance throughout. With the Jet Airways problems we were all concerned but your team helped put our minds at rest with documentation and assistance. Your communications and attentiveness Doreen was extremely helpful and dependable and again, thanks on a personal level. We hope that some of our family will be visiting the TAJ Gateway again soon.
place: The Gateway Hotel Old Port Rd Mangalore

title: Hotel great. Beefeater restaurant - TERRIBLE.
text:
The Premier Inn was as usual excellent. Very nice receptionist, no problems at all.
We had dinner on the meal deal in the Beefeater pubby restaurant downstairs. Absolutely terrible. Verging on inedible. laughable, awful, disgraceful excuse for restaurant food. Nachos: never seen anything like this. NO cheese, no melted cheese at all! had to ask for a pot of grated cheese and I was treated as if nobody in the world had ever expected cheese on nachos. Is this a Swansea thing? It can't be. Surely nachos always has cheese? Squirted greyish salsa around some tired totilla chips, no guacamole. Absolutely terrible. Nothing fresh or real on the plate. Prawn cocktail a joke. All sauce hardly any prawns. etc etc. Terrible. Avoid. Not even cheap.

text: There was a time when this place had very friendly staff and served excellent authentic south Indian food, prepared by Indian people. Then it moved next door. On this visit I found the food Bland and samey and then a substantial service charge was added that we were not expecting. We were the only ones in there and all in all, this was a bad experience and not good value for money.

Absolutely top of the heap. Why drink overpriced unknown beers that taste like dishwater when you can come here. Friendly staff, great service and great location.

title: Lots to do. Excellent park.
text: Worth travelling to. Golf course, kids bmx track, general playground, running track, free to use bowling green, free parking. Very good park. I wish all parks still had so much to offer.

title: Very good leisure pool, warm water.
text: Cafe closed at lunchtime due to staff lunchbreak. Apart from that, all round very good experience. Free parking, reasonable price for family ticket. Kids stayed in a long time.

title: Cocktails and service very good
text: Excellent atmosphere. Not packed but relaxed punters and very friendly and helpful staff. Good music, very good sound system and the cocktails were easy to order, well presented and did not involve a long wait at the bar. Recommended.

title: Curry night is on the way out in GB
text: I think this is the reason why the British curry restaurant is in decline. This establishment caters for the tipsy city centre reveller. Not a fine dining experience and on reflection one wishes one had not been. I know I can go to classy places like Thali cafe, and comprehensive places like zaza bazaar and get high quality decent Indian food with good ingredients and varied and interesting Indian food items. But I would be visiting them sober and with high expectations. On this visit to the Raj, food was served in large quantities and with 'lowest common denominator' spice and flavour factors. You really would only appreciate it after ten pints and it was extremely Bland. I don't recommend this place at all but, like a donor kebab, at the right time after a certain amount of beer, it hits the spot. That's all.

It may be organic and possibly some of it sourced locally, but so much of it is rarely fresh and quite often I see fruit and veg that is positively off. I noticed that the mejoul dates are from Israel so I'm not sure where their 'ethical' boundaries lie. 'Ethical' is in their header strap line on signage, so I think they should come right out and say whether or not they support the Israeli apartheid regime. You expect from places like Asda a non-caring or not thought out sourcing philosphy but a shop that pronounces ethical sourcing should explain why it advertises Israel in its shop. You can import dates from Palestine or central Africa

Hobbs House bread stockist, so low quality pappy bread available.

Stockist of Southville Hop beer so that is one good thing.

Make sure you have plenty of cash on you when shopping here. And, is the veg really organic and local? Or was it procured from the bins behind asda?

Clientele: mixed men and women. The only good thing about it is that it isn't over blokey.
Beer: universally and comprehensively awful. Some of them are truly undrinkable. Overpriced by a long way.
Staff: generally quite rude, arrogant and condescending. If you don't stroke your chin while ordering or tasting from a range of orangey and lemony dishwater concoctions, you will be looked at and spoken to as if they would rather you left.
Location: very good.
Value for money: terrible.
Demographic: White middle class middle-aged bubble.

I have been to this place several times and finally decided to give it the bad review it so deserves. I honestly can't ever believe it is so bad so I occasionally give it another try. Last night I paid 8.70 for a fizzy water and a bottle of supposedly Belgian beer (33cl). I managed half of it before giving up as it was lemony and tasted nothing like any Belgian beer I have ever had. I physically could not finish it as it was so unpleasantn and one of my friends could not drink his 33cl of pale ale draught dishwater.

Avoid this place unless you want to mix with the kind of people mentioned above and sample dishwater in 33cl glasses. That this place is so busy, to me, is worrying.

title: Lovely food. Fabulous hosts.
text:
I was with my 12 year old daughter in Ostende at 2.15pm getting hungry. Car navigator took me to Hilde's restaurant De Vlasschaard. What a find!! Very welcoming Hilde and her staff. The food was excellent, and large portions. Quick service, attentive and friendly at all time. Cannot praise it enough. Cosy, and quirky. So so easy and I cannot speak any Flemish so I praise the experience very highly as a tourist in need of some quick, easy, wholesome grub. By the way, my steak was lovely and the deserts equally lovely and generous portioned.

To top it all, Hilde chatted to me about the area and gave me some great information. I cannot wait to go on one of her beer tours and hope to keep in touch.

All round MAGNIFIICENT. Long live Ostende, Belgian beer and De Vlasschaard.

title: Doors got stuck
text:
It was going so well but when we 'arrived' back at Folkestone (this was a day trip), the front door of the train got stuck and would not open for disembarking. We had to wait an hour while they worked out what to do and eventually we all reversed and got out of the rear train door. Regular announcements gave no clue that there was an alternative door and I think we all thought we would be stuck there for the night. Solution, next time please say 'we are trying to fix the door, but don't worry, if we can't fix it soon we will get you reversed out. No need to panic'.

PS, on the way over ALL the toilets were flooded and overflowing and the flushes not working. felt like a thiord-world train. Yuk.

title: Too much MSG man
text: Very nice but please hold the salt and MSG next time. Greek style. Unusual and very nice. Done quickly and good service.

title: Ok. very good location. Thank you staff at The Carlton for a very friendly welcome and excellent service.
text:
The price led me here as I wanted a basic cheap overnight stop before boarding Eurotunnel early morning for a same-day return.

Perfect for Eurotunnel as a ten-minute drive to the terminal. Basically, this is a one or two star hotel (no idea how to class it but i would accept their classification of 2, without quibbling). It cost me £10 per night more than an overnight parking ticket at Maidstone services. A WHOLE lot better than sleeping in a van in a motorway services. Excellent location, 3 minutes to all the takeaways and supermarket.

Room very basic, clean sheets and clean towels, warm (with a heater), sea view. Electric shower (no need to say more), pretty grubby generally in the room but you get what you pay for. Decent TV.

PLUS - extremely nice man running the place greeted us very politely and was very very pleasant at all times. The ground floor and reception is very smart and nicely decorated. The bar is excellent and the lounge also very nice with a gas fire and large TV playing music. He let us bring takeaways to the room which some hotels don't like. The breakfast we took on the second morning was perfectly OK for £7 each, including a decent full English, unlimited toast and all the cereals and condiments and coffee on a buffet table. Can't really argue with that. 24 hour main door security.

To be honest, not sure I would go back unless their restaurant that is being refurbished is an Indian restaurant, which it might be. This was a budget trip to buy stock in Belgium and costs were being kept to the minimum. I went with my 12-year-old daughter who - incidentally - loved it!!! but if I was going again with all the family I would be paying more and staying elsewhere, like the snob I am ;)

Thank you staff at The Carlton for a very friendly welcome and excellent service. I wish you all the best. It is a massive grand hotel and will take some doing to maintain and upgrade it. Keep up the good work.

title: similar facilities and feel to Brean Sands/Burnham on Sea
text:
I'd forgotten how middle class this part of France is. If you want to go on holiday in France and speak English all the time, see no black people nor east Europeans, etc etc., this bubble is perfect. I could be more specific about this site but generally I think that is over-safe, slightly boring, and has similar facilities and feel to Brean Sands/Burnham on Sea. Of course, the weather is more reliable and you can eat oysters and speak French if you really want to.

It's a lot cheaper than Croatia for example but a long drive, with the risk of bumping in to Fred and Janice from up the road.

Highlights: Excellent beach down the road but needs waves (otherwise boring). Towels cannot be used to bag and hold sunbeds on the campsite poolside. Pelforth on tap was lovely. Rude bar manager who actually was really easy to twist round your finger with some French and sympathising with his over-strict rules like no bare feet, no bare tops, no dripping water in the bar, no kids sitting on arms of sofas, etc etc etc.
place: Camping Marvilla Parks - Le Clarys Plage

title: my son's gluten free one was good too
text: Burgers were fine. no problem. And my son's gluten free one was good too. But the skinny fries are too skinny. Ridiculously skinny. No longer fries, they are so skinny.

title: The location is perfect for Notting Hill, Portobello, walk to Bayswater, Hyde Park
text:
Very very good. The bar/restaurant, and the hotel.

Friendly staff throughout, great pub and busy too and good music. Excellent breakfast. Excellent service. Excellent location. Flexible check in. Could not fault it. Some people on google reviews complain about lack of a lift. Come on. A few flights of stairs, and direct access to the street, as well as the pub/restaurant.

The owner seems to take a very keen interest in the place, visible in the pub setting up and arranging candles and fresh flowers.

Once again, highly recommended and the location is perfect for Notting Hill, Portobello, walk to Bayswater, Hyde Park and Knightsbridge. Near a tube station if you don't fancy walking.

title: Excellent music, really friendly staff, good food, cocktails.
text: Really good place. Very stylish. Busy on a Friday evening with an interesting and friendly crowd. Music was good and a DJ was setting up for later. Recommended. And the hotel above is excellent as well.

title: Very friendly and helpful staff
text: Always friendly and very nice staff. North Street Coffee #1. Recommended. Excellent food as well as the obvious great range of drinks. And loads of space. Not many babies.

title: Fantastic spot, right on the beach, close to Bora Bora. Friendly and excellent food.
text:
The only criticisms I would have are: 1) I chose to pay extra (quite a bit) for a sea view. Yes, the view of the pool and the beach and sea are excellent. BUT, the rooms seem to attract smoking guests. So, in fact, the smell was unbearable to us (non-smokers). Room 225 we had to move out of because the bedroom is adjacent to a balcony window and the smell was terrible.Room 226 was marginally better but my clothes all smelled of fags when I got home.

2) The music played on the poolside never did anything for me. It actually drove me out one morning as I got taken the wrong way while trying to order breakfast. There was no effort put in to play interesting or just house music in general. In fact, nearly all the time, if on the poolside (a lot, mainly because Bora Bora was closed and JET was full of blokes) you can only hear muffled music half drowned out by louder music on either side.

Other than that....the food is EXCELLENT. Good value, high high quality, fast service, very friendly staff all of them, well stocked bar with lots of options. Very friendly and helpful manager and reception. Clean pool, clean poolside, clean hotel, clean rooms, clean kitchens. Excellent spot on the beach. Happy relaxed punters. Flexible reception regarding early and late check in which is, of course, so important in Ibiza.

Strongly recommended hotel and restaurant though I would beg them to rectify points 1 and 2 above.

title: Such an excellent addition to Playa d'en Bossa. How did we ever do without it?
text:
Just brilliant. Music policy seems to be mainly minimal techno and tech house, which is fantastic, but always good music. DJ there in the evenings to make it feel like a clubby bar. Food is excellent, drinks and cocktails excellent, staff friendly and helpful. Danced there, drunk there, the past two seasons, clubbed there, eaten there. Perfectly suited to the 30s upwards crowd for pre and alt club.

One criticism - Why no DUNES T shirts on sale????

title: Why is it so many people start drinking at 8am in this place? Aha - Bartolo!!
text:
Love it. Stayed there for a third time this June. As good as ever. Bartolo is a great bloke and Bartolo's staff. Super friendly. Really relaxed and such a perfect location.

Tip - go for an early morning run past Cala Gracio aquarium turn off, along the road, 3 Km to the rocks and bays, run back, jump in the pool, then sit and stare at the sea. Great preparation for an early morning beer, but don't ask him for a Vodka and Coke at 9am unless you expect to be out of the game by 1pm.

Rooms, pool, location, people, staff, food...all top class. Thoroughly recommended to all. And families and clubbers co-exist.

title: The BEST Indian restaurant in Bristol
text:
I have no doubt in saying this is the best Indian restaurant in our city (that is - the Indian section of zaza bazaar :) ). The range of food is incredible. North and South Indian, street food and all the old familiar favourites are all there. Plus - freshly made dosa. say no more! I lived in India for two years and have difficulty settling back in to standard Indian restaurants in the UK. But the sheer quality, the broad range, the experienced chefs, and the value for money - all make this the best little Indian corner that cannot be touched by any Indian restaurant in Bristol. Where else in the UK have I seen Pani Puri? a dosa man? etc etc.

Extremely educational for kids. A utopia for international foodies. And I have only spoken about the Indian section so far. My son is gluten free and likes NANDOS. Well, excuse me but here at za za bazaar you can get peri peri chicken cooked in front of you to your liking, as much as you can eat. And noodle soup, at the Chinese counter......etc etc etc.............................utopia!!!!
